result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Peter Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 17CM11

records.addlTxt: 9:59 a.m.  Includes 15CM192, 16CM41, 17CM11, 17CT7.  O'Sullivan 15CM159, motion to revoke, have a stip agreement, Agreement in 15CM192, all other cases would be dismissed.  Court grants state's motion to revoke deferred, enter judgment of conviction. Defendant Thomas Peter Nelson in court with attorney Adam P Nero.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  17CM11 - Judge reviews plea waiver with defendant.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2 in 17CM11.  Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 17CM11.  Court dismisses charges in 15CM192, 16CM41, Ct. 1 and Ct 3 in 17CM11, and 17CT7 dismissed. 17CM11, Ct 2 - Court orders S/W, 2 years probation, court costs in the amount of $443. DNA sample and surcharge.  15cm159, deferred revoked, judgment of conviction entered.  Court costs in the amount of $443.00.  Appeal rights are given.
